intro: Oxypetalum erectum, commonly known as the upright oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Oxypetalum erectum is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
